result.execSummary:
The defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  To run concurrent as to each count.  Credit for 138 days.  TIME SERVED.  Good time credit.
**Court ordered the remaining 18 days of credit will be in lieu of all costs and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Broderick Emanuel Shelton Jr

records.addlTxt: VICTIM CAME IN TO NOTIFY THAT THE ADDRESS ON ID IS CORRECT. LJ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Year of offense date only (to read 2015), per change by DA on Information.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS, to run concurrent as to each count, in the House of Correction, with credit for 138 days TIME SERVED, with good time credit.  Court orded the remaining 18 DAYS of credit will be in lieu of all costs and disbursements.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 1 from Bob Scares (Felony)  TO  Disorderly Conduct under Wisconsin Stats. 947.01(1), and 939.51(3)(b) a Class B Misdemeanor.   Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. *.Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton not in court, defendant in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Plaisted in trial this morning in another court as is Branch 20.  Case remains calendared for jury trial before Branch 20 on 6/03/15 at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.

State's Witness List, received and filed with:
 - State's Motion in Limine.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard  for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the court that his client will not proceed with a special plea and withdraws his plea of NGI.  Court had colloquy with defendant and defendant stated same.  Court ordered special plea withdrawn.  Defense counsel requested another final pretrial date; parties still negotiating.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 20. All motions in limine, witnees lists and jury instructions must be filed with the court by 5/22/15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Case passed to 5/14/15 at 1:30 p.m.  File retained in court.
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of 437.50 to Dr. Collins for services on 03/18, 03/20 of 2015
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received and gone over by all parties, which does not support the special plea.  Defense counsel requested a second opinion; Court granted defense request and continued matter for trial and return on doctor's report before Branch 20.  Any motions must be filed by 4/15/15; response due by 5/05/15; reply due by 5/08/15.  Alibi notices must be filed according to statute.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/filed.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Parties requested that Dr. Collins examine defendant for the special plea.  Court ordered same and continued matter before Branch 20.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/for Examination Under 971.16, signed and filed.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Ron Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Pollard-MCSD Deputy.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Arraignment scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Arguments heard as to bail.  Court set bail at $2,500.00 CASH with TOT to Justice Point: no controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant; no alcohol; no firearms or weapons; random testing.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are in receipt of doctor's report.  Court has colloquy with defendant who believes he is competent to assist his attorney.  Neither the State nor defense counsel challenge findings in report or defendant's own assertions.  Based upon information, Court finds defendant is competent to proceed and ordered proceedings reinstated.  Case is continued before Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/received and filed.

Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Broderick Emanuel Shelton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
State moves to amend both counts of the criminal complaint to reflect the correct offense date of January 14, 2015.  Defense does not object.  Court grants request and orders complaint amended to reflect correct offense date of January 14, 2015 as to both counts.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
